channel.title: Client IP?
channel.description: I can't seem to find it in any of the files, what do I search exactly or do I need to look in the Source? - Thanks Disengage.

item.title: Client IP?

item.title: Client IP?
item.dc:creator: @vamp256 vamp256
item.description:
@vamp256 wrote:

[quote=“Disengage, post:5, topic:392211”][quote author=vrac defiled link=topic=489377.msg3578081#msg3578081 date=1303586824]
well its in client.java

just search for “server” and it will be server == IP
[/quote]
Still nothing, all I’ve found is:

public static String server = “”;

server = “myservernamehere.no-ip.info”

public URL getCodeBase() {

	try {
		rserver = "myservernamehere.no-ip.info"
	} catch(Exception _ex) {
	}
	return null;
}

if(myPrivilege >= 2 || server.equals(“myservernamehere.no-ip.info”) || 1 == 1)

return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(server), port);

Are any of these correct one I’m looking for?[/quote]
Use the [code] tag please.
In

there should be a

Localhost, being the IP for you server.

item.title: Client IP?
item.dc:creator: @Disengage Disengage
item.description:
@Disengage wrote:

[quote=“vrac defiled, post:4, topic:392211”]well its in client.java

just search for “server” and it will be server == IP[/quote]
Still nothing, all I’ve found is:

public static String server = “”;

server = “myservernamehere.no-ip.info”

public URL getCodeBase() {

	try {
		rserver = "myservernamehere.no-ip.info"
	} catch(Exception _ex) {
	}
	return null;
}

if(myPrivilege >= 2 || server.equals(“myservernamehere.no-ip.info”) || 1 == 1)

return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(server), port);

Are any of these correct one I’m looking for?
